00020 
00021 /* The defaults.h file serves as a central default settings file for different machine
00022    types, from DIY CNC mills to CNC conversions of off-the-shelf machines. The settings
00023    here are supplied by users, so your results may vary. However, this should give you
00024    a good starting point as you get to know your machine and tweak the settings for your
00025    our nefarious needs. */
00026 
00027 #ifndef defaults_h
00028 #define defaults_h
00029 
00030 // IMPORTANT: Any changes here requires a full re-compiling of the source code to propagate them.
00031 
00032 #ifdef DEFAULTS_LETARTARE
00033 
00034 /// 845
00035 //==============================================================================
00036 /// This is where you define the type of the fourth axis T
00037 ///  - T = axis U, V, W linear or  axis A, B, C rotary
00038 ///  - The axis T uses MEGA2560 Digital pin 28
00039 
00040   #define LINEAR 0  //  0 -> linear T = U or V or W
00041   #define ROTARY 1  //  1 -> rotary T = A or B or C
00042 /// ====> You must choose only one type, but not both  <====
00043   //#define AXIS_T_TYPE  LINEAR   //  0 -> linear
00044   #define AXIS_T_TYPE  ROTARY   //  1 -> rotary
00045   // Checking the definition of "AXIS_T_TYPE"
00046   #ifndef AXIS_T_TYPE
00047      #error "The macro "AXIS_T_TYPE" is not defined"
00048   #endif
00049 
00050 /// axis choice
00051  #if AXIS_T_TYPE == LINEAR
00052  #define AXIS_U   4
00053  #define AXIS_V   5
00054  #define AXIS_W   6
00055  // linear axis
00056  #define AXIS_T  AXIS_U  /// ==> You must choose your fourth linear axis  <==
00057  #elif AXIS_T_TYPE == ROTARY
00058  #define AXIS_A   7
00059  #define AXIS_B   8
00060  #define AXIS_C   9
00061  // rotary axis
00062  #define AXIS_T  AXIS_A  /// ==> You must choose your rotary fourth axis  <==
00063  #else
00064  /// -> (X, Y, Z)
00065  #endif
00066 
00067  // Checking the definition of "AXIS_T"
00068  #ifndef AXIS_T
00069      #error "The macro "AXIS_T" is not defined"
00070   #endif
00071 
00072 //==============================================================================
00073 
00074 //==============================================================================
00075 /// This is where you define the common characteristics of
00076 ///   - stepper motors
00077 ///   - power interface
00078 ///   - pitch screw for linear axis
00079 ///   - ratio_table for rotary axis
00080 
00081   ///  step_per_revolution = number of motor steps per revolution
00082   #define USER_STEP_PER_REVOLUTION  200
00083   /// board TB6560 -> 2 탎teps
00084   #define USER_MICROSTEPS 2
00085   ///  pitch_screw = pitch of screw
00086   #define USER_PITCH_SCREW   4   // 4mm for all linear axes
00087   #define USER_STEP_MM  (USER_STEP_PER_REVOLUTION/USER_PITCH_SCREW)
00088   ///  ratio_table  =  the worm gear ratio
00089   #define USER_RATIO_TABLE  90   // for rotary axis
00090 //==============================================================================
00091 /// <==
00092 
00093 // Grbl generic default settings. Should work across different machines.
00094   #define DEFAULT_X_STEPS_PER_MM (USER_STEP_MM*USER_MICROSTEPS) //  -> 1 탎tep = 0.01 mm
00095   #define DEFAULT_Y_STEPS_PER_MM (USER_STEP_MM*USER_MICROSTEPS)
00096   #define DEFAULT_Z_STEPS_PER_MM (USER_STEP_MM*USER_MICROSTEPS)
00097 /// =====> 845  :  T in  U, if A, B, C -> mm = degree
00098 #define DEFAULT_T_STEPS_PER_MM (USER_STEP_MM*USER_MICROSTEPS)
00099   // user values
00100   // calculated value Grbl = ratio_table*step_per_revolution/360
00101   #define USER_TABLE   ((USER_RATIO_TABLE*USER_STEP_PER_REVOLUTION)/360.0)
00102   // STEPS_PER_DEGREE = (ratio_table*step_per_revolution/360)*MICROSTEPS)
00103   // 탎tep/degree   1 탎tep = 0,01 
00104   #define DEFAULT_T_STEPS_PER_DEGREE (USER_TABLE*USER_MICROSTEPS)
00105 /// <=====
00106 
00107   #define DEFAULT_STEP_PULSE_MICROSECONDS 10
00108   #define DEFAULT_MM_PER_ARC_SEGMENT 0.1
00109   #define DEFAULT_RAPID_FEEDRATE 1500.0 // mm/min
00110   #define DEFAULT_FEEDRATE 750.0
00111   #define DEFAULT_ACCELERATION (DEFAULT_FEEDRATE*60*60/10.0) // 10 mm/min^2
00112   #define DEFAULT_JUNCTION_DEVIATION 0.05 // mm
00113 // ==> 844 add  axis T
00114   #define DEFAULT_STEPPING_INVERT_MASK ((1<<X_STEP_BIT)|(1<<Y_STEP_BIT)|(1<<Z_STEP_BIT)|(1<<T_STEP_BIT))
00115 
00116   #define DEFAULT_LIMIT_INVERT_MASK 0 // active-low endstops by default
00117   // #define DEFAULT_AUTO_START 1 // Boolean
00118   #define SPINDLE_PWM 0 // Spindle PWM NOT Active as default
00119   #define DEFAULT_SPINDLE_SPEED 300 // RPM
00120   #define MAX_SPINDLE_SPEED 1000 // RPM
00121 // <==
00122 
00123 /// ==> 0.842 : 0.8c not use actually !!  to introduce in 0.843 ?
00124   #define DEFAULT_REPORT_INCHES 0 // false
00125   #define DEFAULT_AUTO_START 1 // true
00126   #define DEFAULT_INVERT_ST_ENABLE 0 // false
00127   #define DEFAULT_HARD_LIMIT_ENABLE 0  // false
00128   #define DEFAULT_HOMING_ENABLE 0  // false
00129   #define DEFAULT_HOMING_DIR_MASK 0 // move positive dir
00130   #define DEFAULT_HOMING_RAPID_FEEDRATE 250.0 // mm/min
00131   #define DEFAULT_HOMING_FEEDRATE 25.0 // mm/min
00132   #define DEFAULT_HOMING_DEBOUNCE_DELAY 100 // msec (0-65k)
00133   #define DEFAULT_HOMING_PULLOFF 1.0 // mm
00134   #define DEFAULT_STEPPER_IDLE_LOCK_TIME 25 // msec (0-255)
00135   #define DEFAULT_DECIMAL_PLACES 3
00136   #define DEFAULT_N_ARC_CORRECTION 25
00137 #endif

00198 #ifdef DEFAULTS_SHAPEOKO
00199   // Description: Shapeoko CNC mill with three NEMA 17 stepper motors, driven by Synthetos
00200   // grblShield with a 24V, 4.2A power supply.
00201   #define MICROSTEPS_XY 8
00202   #define STEP_REVS_XY 400
00203   #define MM_PER_REV_XY (0.08*18*MM_PER_INCH) // 0.08 in belt pitch, 18 pulley teeth

00208   #define DEFAULT_Y_STEPS_PER_MM (MICROSTEPS_XY*STEP_REVS_XY/MM_PER_REV_XY)
00209   #define DEFAULT_Z_STEPS_PER_MM (MICROSTEPS_Z*STEP_REVS_Z/MM_PER_REV_Z)
00210   #define DEFAULT_STEP_PULSE_MICROSECONDS 10
00211   #define DEFAULT_MM_PER_ARC_SEGMENT 0.1
00212   #define DEFAULT_RAPID_FEEDRATE 1000.0 // mm/min
00213   #define DEFAULT_FEEDRATE 250.0

00232 #ifdef DEFAULTS_ZEN_TOOLWORKS_7x7
00233   // Description: Zen Toolworks 7x7 mill with three Shinano SST43D2121 65oz-in NEMA 17 stepper motors.
